attributes.name: lang
attributes.description: Optional ISO 639-1 code describing the language element content is written in.

attributes.name: parent
attributes.description: Optional URL of the collection this element's resource belongs to.

attributes.name: group
attributes.description: Rumour group. Elements in different groups will not share updates. Empty by default.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: Optional URL of the resource to load. Switches element to `idle.template` state if empty (default).

properties.name: UpdateEvent
properties.description:
Instances of this event are dispatched on an element whenever it changes its
state (e.g. when going from `busy` to `idle` or on `form` data change).
This event isn't cancelable, and it does not bubble.

properties.name: Rumour
properties.description:
Creates a tagged [Rumour](https://sdk.foxy.dev/classes/_core_index_.rumour.html)
instance if it doesn't exist or returns cached one otherwise. NucleonElements
use empty Rumour group by default.

properties.name: API
properties.description:
Universal [API](https://sdk.foxy.dev/classes/_core_index_.api.html) client
that dispatches cancellable `FetchEvent` on an element before each request.

properties.name: lang
properties.description: Optional ISO 639-1 code describing the language element content is written in.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: Optional URL of the collection this element's resource belongs to.

properties.name: errors
properties.description:
Array of validation errors returned from `NucleonElement.v8n` checks.

This property is readonly. Adding or removing error codes via this property is
not guaranteed to work. NucleonElement does not provide a way to override validity status.

properties.name: form
properties.description:
Resource snapshot with edits applied. Empty object if unavailable.

This property and its value are readonly. Assignments like `element.data.foo = 'bar'`
are not guaranteed to work. Please use `element.edit({ foo: 'bar' })` instead.
If you need to replace the entire data object, consider using `element.data`.

properties.name: data
properties.description:
Resource snapshot as-is, no edits applied. Null if unavailable.

Returned value is not reactive. Assignments like `element.data.foo = 'bar'`
are not guaranteed to work. Please set the property instead: `element.data = { ...element.data, foo: 'bar' }`.
If you're processing user input, consider using `element.form` and `element.edit()` instead.

properties.name: group
properties.description: Rumour group. Elements in different groups will not share updates. Empty by default.

properties.name: href
properties.description: Optional URL of the resource to load. Switches element to `idle.template` state if empty (default).

events.name: update
events.description: Instance of `NucleonElement.UpdateEvent`. Dispatched on an element whenever it changes its state.

events.name: fetch
events.description: Instance of `NucleonElement.API.FetchEvent`. Emitted before each API request.

attributes.name: lang
attributes.description:
Contains the language this component presents its translatable
content in. Assigning a value to this property will load new
translations in background and trigger a render afterwards.

**Example:** `"en"`

attributes.name: ns
attributes.description:
The namespace to look for the translations in. We use this property to
sync namespace settings with the parent element and it's highly unlikely
that you'll ever need to set or read it in your code.

**Example:** `"admin"`

tags.name: foxy-donation
tags.description: A custom element providing customizable donation forms.

attributes.name: currency
attributes.description:
**Required** 3-letter lowercase currency code.

**Example:** `"usd"`

attributes.name: amount
attributes.description:
**Required** donation amount in specified currency. When more than one amount option
is available, this field will contain the selected amount. This value is deliberately not
limited to the predefined options: whatever you set it to will show up in the cart.

**Example:** `25`

attributes.name: store
attributes.description:
**Required** store subdomain. This is usually the part after before `.foxycart.com`
and after `https://`, e.g. the `foxy-demo` bit of `https://foxy-demo.foxycart.com`.

**Example:** `"foxy-demo"`

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
**Required** product name for this donation. This will show up in the cart when this form is submitted.
See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `"One-time donation"`

attributes.name: custom
attributes.description:
Optional parts of the form including a custom ("other") option.
Adding `amount` to this array will enable custom amount.

**Example:** `["amount"]`

attributes.name: amounts
attributes.description:
Optional donation amount variants. If this property is set, the form will render
the amount selection interface. If this array includes the value of the `amount` property,
it will be pre-selected in the form.

**Example:** `[25, 50, 75]`

attributes.name: frequency
attributes.description:
Optional donation frequency string encoded as count (integer) + units (one
of: `d` for days, `w` for weeks, `m` for months, `y` for years). A special
value for twice a month is also supported: `.5m`. If set, the form will
create a subscription with the specified frequency in the cart. This value is deliberately not
limited to the predefined options: whatever you set it to will show up in the cart.

**Example:** `"1m"`

attributes.name: frequencies
attributes.description:
Optional donation frequency variants in the same format as `frequency`. If this property is set,
the form will render the frequency selection interface. If this array includes
the value of the `frequency` property, it will be pre-selected in the form.

**Example:** `["7d", ".5m", "1y"]`

attributes.name: designation
attributes.description:
Optional donation designation(s). The form will serialize and pass this value to the cart
on submission. This value is deliberately not limited to the predefined options:
whatever you set it to will show up in the cart.

**Example:** `"Medical Care"`
**Example:** `["Medical Care", "Daily Meals"]`

attributes.name: designations
attributes.description:
Optional donation designation(s) variants. If this property is set,
the form will render the designation selection interface: multiple choice
if `designation` is an array and a single choice otherwise. All values overlapping
with the `designation` property will be pre-selected in the form.

**Example:** `["Medical Care", "Daily Meals", "Area of Greatest Need"]`

attributes.name: comment
attributes.description:
Optional comment accompanying the donation. If set (even to an empty string),
the form will render a comment field. The value of this property will be updated
as the customer enters their message and will be added to the order as a custom field in the end.

**Example:** `""`

attributes.name: anonymity
attributes.description:
Optional switch controlling visibility of the anonymity checkbox. If set to `true`, the form
will render the checkbox. All changes in the value are reflected to the attribute.

**Example:** `true`

attributes.name: anonymous
attributes.description:
Optional switch marking this donation as anonymous via a custom field when set to `true`. When
the anonymity checkbox is rendered, also checks or unchecks it depending on the value.
All changes in the value are reflected to the attribute.

**Example:** `true`

attributes.name: image
attributes.description:
Optional product image URL (absolute path). This property affects cart UI only.
See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `"https://picsum.photos/320"`

attributes.name: code
attributes.description:
Optional product code for this donation. This property affects cart UI only.
See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `"ISBN 978-0-12-345678-9"`

attributes.name: url
attributes.description:
Optional product URL for this donation. Accepts a full URL to the product page, starting
with `http://` or `https://`, or a relative path to the produt from the store's
domain (as configured in the store settings). This property affects cart UI only.
See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `"https://example.com/my-product"`

attributes.name: cart
attributes.description:
Optional cart
If set to 'add' will add items to the cart and, on submit, user is redirected to the cart.
If set to 'checkout', the default, on submit user is redirected to checkout directly

attributes.name: empty
attributes.description:
Optional empty
If set to 'true' clears the contents of the cart prior to adding the donation to the cart
If set to 'reset' clears the contents of the cart and cookies prior to adding the donation to the cart

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Optional target to display the form response.

attributes.name: lang
attributes.description:
Contains the language this component presents its translatable
content in. Assigning a value to this property will load new
translations in background and trigger a render afterwards.

**Example:** `"en"`

attributes.name: ns
attributes.description:
The namespace to look for the translations in. We use this property to
sync namespace settings with the parent element and it's highly unlikely
that you'll ever need to set or read it in your code.

**Example:** `"admin"`

properties.name: currency
properties.description:
**Required** 3-letter lowercase currency code.

**Example:** `"usd"`

properties.name: amount
properties.description:
**Required** donation amount in specified currency. When more than one amount option
is available, this field will contain the selected amount. This value is deliberately not
limited to the predefined options: whatever you set it to will show up in the cart.

**Example:** `25`

properties.name: store
properties.description:
**Required** store subdomain. This is usually the part after before `.foxycart.com`
and after `https://`, e.g. the `foxy-demo` bit of `https://foxy-demo.foxycart.com`.

**Example:** `"foxy-demo"`

properties.name: name
properties.description:
**Required** product name for this donation. This will show up in the cart when this form is submitted.
See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `"One-time donation"`

properties.name: custom
properties.description:
Optional parts of the form including a custom ("other") option.
Adding `amount` to this array will enable custom amount.

**Example:** `["amount"]`

properties.name: amounts
properties.description:
Optional donation amount variants. If this property is set, the form will render
the amount selection interface. If this array includes the value of the `amount` property,
it will be pre-selected in the form.

**Example:** `[25, 50, 75]`

properties.name: frequency
properties.description:
Optional donation frequency string encoded as count (integer) + units (one
of: `d` for days, `w` for weeks, `m` for months, `y` for years). A special
value for twice a month is also supported: `.5m`. If set, the form will
create a subscription with the specified frequency in the cart. This value is deliberately not
limited to the predefined options: whatever you set it to will show up in the cart.

**Example:** `"1m"`

properties.name: frequencies
properties.description:
Optional donation frequency variants in the same format as `frequency`. If this property is set,
the form will render the frequency selection interface. If this array includes
the value of the `frequency` property, it will be pre-selected in the form.

**Example:** `["7d", ".5m", "1y"]`

properties.name: designation
properties.description:
Optional donation designation(s). The form will serialize and pass this value to the cart
on submission. This value is deliberately not limited to the predefined options:
whatever you set it to will show up in the cart.

**Example:** `"Medical Care"`
**Example:** `["Medical Care", "Daily Meals"]`

properties.name: designations
properties.description:
Optional donation designation(s) variants. If this property is set,
the form will render the designation selection interface: multiple choice
if `designation` is an array and a single choice otherwise. All values overlapping
with the `designation` property will be pre-selected in the form.

**Example:** `["Medical Care", "Daily Meals", "Area of Greatest Need"]`

properties.name: comment
properties.description:
Optional comment accompanying the donation. If set (even to an empty string),
the form will render a comment field. The value of this property will be updated
as the customer enters their message and will be added to the order as a custom field in the end.

**Example:** `""`

properties.name: anonymity
properties.description:
Optional switch controlling visibility of the anonymity checkbox. If set to `true`, the form
will render the checkbox. All changes in the value are reflected to the attribute.

**Example:** `true`

properties.name: anonymous
properties.description:
Optional switch marking this donation as anonymous via a custom field when set to `true`. When
the anonymity checkbox is rendered, also checks or unchecks it depending on the value.
All changes in the value are reflected to the attribute.

**Example:** `true`

properties.name: image
properties.description:
Optional product image URL (absolute path). This property affects cart UI only.
See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `"https://picsum.photos/320"`

properties.name: code
properties.description:
Optional product code for this donation. This property affects cart UI only.
See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `"ISBN 978-0-12-345678-9"`

properties.name: url
properties.description:
Optional product URL for this donation. Accepts a full URL to the product page, starting
with `http://` or `https://`, or a relative path to the produt from the store's
domain (as configured in the store settings). This property affects cart UI only.
See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `"https://example.com/my-product"`

properties.name: cart
properties.description:
Optional cart
If set to 'add' will add items to the cart and, on submit, user is redirected to the cart.
If set to 'checkout', the default, on submit user is redirected to checkout directly

properties.name: empty
properties.description:
Optional empty
If set to 'true' clears the contents of the cart prior to adding the donation to the cart
If set to 'reset' clears the contents of the cart and cookies prior to adding the donation to the cart

properties.name: target
properties.description: Optional target to display the form response.

properties.name: lang
properties.description:
Contains the language this component presents its translatable
content in. Assigning a value to this property will load new
translations in background and trigger a render afterwards.

**Example:** `"en"`

properties.name: ns
properties.description:
The namespace to look for the translations in. We use this property to
sync namespace settings with the parent element and it's highly unlikely
that you'll ever need to set or read it in your code.

**Example:** `"admin"`

events.name: change
events.description: Instance of `Donation.events.change`. Emitted after user input triggers a change in the form data.

events.name: submit
events.description: Instance of `Donation.events.submit`. Emitted when the form is submitted. Cancelling this event will stop the submission.

slots.name: amount
slots.description: Space below the amount selector, if it's visible.

slots.name: designation
slots.description: Space below the designation selector, if it's visible.

slots.name: comment
slots.description: Space below the comment field, if it's visible.

tags.name: foxy-i18n
tags.description: Custom element for effortless localization with i18next.

attributes.name: options
attributes.description:
Optional i18next translation function
[options](https://www.i18next.com/translation-function/essentials#overview-options).

attributes.name: lang
attributes.description:
Optional language to translate `element.key` into (ISO 639-1).
Default and fallback: `en`.

attributes.name: key
attributes.description:
Optional key to translate. Empty by default (renders nothing).
See [i18next docs](https://www.i18next.com/translation-function/essentials#accessing-keys) for more info.

attributes.name: ns
attributes.description:
Optional namespace to use translations from. Default and fallback: `shared`.
To provide multiple namespaces, separate them with a space.

properties.name: FetchEvent
properties.description: Instances of this event are dispatched on an element before each translation request.

properties.name: i18next
properties.description: Shared [i18next](https://www.i18next.com) instance for all I18n elements.

properties.name: options
properties.description:
Optional i18next translation function
[options](https://www.i18next.com/translation-function/essentials#overview-options).

properties.name: lang
properties.description:
Optional language to translate `element.key` into (ISO 639-1).
Default and fallback: `en`.

properties.name: key
properties.description:
Optional key to translate. Empty by default (renders nothing).
See [i18next docs](https://www.i18next.com/translation-function/essentials#accessing-keys) for more info.

properties.name: ns
properties.description:
Optional namespace to use translations from. Default and fallback: `shared`.
To provide multiple namespaces, separate them with a space.

events.name: fetch
events.description: Instance of `I18n.FetchEvent`. Emitted before each translation request.

tags.name: foxy-items-form
tags.description: A custom element providing a customizable donation form.

attributes.name: store
attributes.description:
**Required** store subdomain, It is similar to mystore.foxycart.com,
unless you use a custom subdomain.

**Examples:** `"mystore.foxycart.com"` `"custom.mycoolstore.com"`

attributes.name: currency
attributes.description:
**Required** 3-letter lowercase currency code.

**Example:** `"usd"`

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
Defines target of the form

This attribute controls the destination window of the form submission.

attributes.name: cart
attributes.description:
Defines the next cart step

It can only be either add or checkout.
If "add" is chosen, this form will add items to the cart and the user will
be directed to the cart with these products added upon submission.

If set to "checkout" (this is the default) the user will be directed to
checkout.

attributes.name: sub_frequency
attributes.description:
Optional frequency string encoded as count (integer) + units (one of: `d`
for days, `w` for weeks, `m` for months, `y` for years). A special value
for twice a month is also supported: `.5m`. If set, the form will create a
subscription with the specified frequency in the cart.

**Example:** `"1m"`

attributes.name: sub_startdate
attributes.description:
Optional subscription start date encoded as four integer for the year, two
for the month and two for the day. If only two or one digits are provided,
it is assumed to be next occurence of that day of the month, from the
current date.

See [Products wiki for more details](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products#a_complete_list_of_product_parameters)

** Example:** `"10"`

attributes.name: sub_token
attributes.description:
Optional subscription token, unique URL of a subscription, retrieved from
the API, XML datafeeds or Admin interface.

attributes.name: sub_modify
attributes.description:
Optional. Allows the “add to cart” link or form to completely replace the
existing subscription loaded

Can be either "replace", "append" or "" (a blank string).
Using "append" or "" will result in adding these items to an existing
subscription in addition to the existing ones.

The "append" value is set for convenience, as it describes the behaviour.
The submitted value, in this case, will be "". The submitted value, in
this case, will be "".

Using "replace" results in replacing the existing subscription with the
current itmes.
See [Products subscription options](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products/subscriptions#subscription-related_product_options)

attributes.name: sub_restart
attributes.description:
Set to "true" to indicate that payment is collectable right now.
Set to "auto" to indicate that payment is collectable right now if the
subscription's past-due amount is greater than 0

attributes.name: sub_enddate
attributes.description:
Optional subscription end date encoded as four integer for the year, two
for the month and two for the day.

The absence of a sub_enddate, together with a sub_frequency, means a
subscription with indefinite and date.

See [Products wiki for more details](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products#a_complete_list_of_product_parameters)

** Example:** `"20221010"`

attributes.name: frequencies
attributes.description:
Optional frequency variants in the same format as `frequency`. If this property is set,
the form will render the frequency selection interface. If this array includes
the value of the `frequency` property, it will be pre-selected in the form.

**Example:** `["7d", ".5m", "1y"]`

attributes.name: items
attributes.description:
Optional an array of ItemInterface objects with at least the following properties:
- name: the name of the item
- price: the price of each of this item
The following optional properties will be used:
- quantity: (defaults to 1) how many of each item are added to the form
- image: an image url to be displayed in the form for this item
- items: an array of other items that are to be treated as bundled with this item
- signatures: an object containing a key value list of previously generated HMAC validation codes

Other item properties are accepted and sent to foxy cart
See [Products wiki for more details](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products#a_complete_list_of_product_parameters)

attributes.name: lang
attributes.description:
Contains the language this component presents its translatable
content in. Assigning a value to this property will load new
translations in background and trigger a render afterwards.

**Example:** `"en"`

attributes.name: ns
attributes.description:
The namespace to look for the translations in. We use this property to
sync namespace settings with the parent element and it's highly unlikely
that you'll ever need to set or read it in your code.

**Example:** `"admin"`

properties.name: store
properties.description:
**Required** store subdomain, It is similar to mystore.foxycart.com,
unless you use a custom subdomain.

**Examples:** `"mystore.foxycart.com"` `"custom.mycoolstore.com"`

properties.name: currency
properties.description:
**Required** 3-letter lowercase currency code.

**Example:** `"usd"`

properties.name: target
properties.description:
Defines target of the form

This attribute controls the destination window of the form submission.

properties.name: cart
properties.description:
Defines the next cart step

It can only be either add or checkout.
If "add" is chosen, this form will add items to the cart and the user will
be directed to the cart with these products added upon submission.

If set to "checkout" (this is the default) the user will be directed to
checkout.

properties.name: sub_frequency
properties.description:
Optional frequency string encoded as count (integer) + units (one of: `d`
for days, `w` for weeks, `m` for months, `y` for years). A special value
for twice a month is also supported: `.5m`. If set, the form will create a
subscription with the specified frequency in the cart.

**Example:** `"1m"`

properties.name: sub_startdate
properties.description:
Optional subscription start date encoded as four integer for the year, two
for the month and two for the day. If only two or one digits are provided,
it is assumed to be next occurence of that day of the month, from the
current date.

See [Products wiki for more details](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products#a_complete_list_of_product_parameters)

** Example:** `"10"`

properties.name: sub_token
properties.description:
Optional subscription token, unique URL of a subscription, retrieved from
the API, XML datafeeds or Admin interface.

properties.name: sub_modify
properties.description:
Optional. Allows the “add to cart” link or form to completely replace the
existing subscription loaded

Can be either "replace", "append" or "" (a blank string).
Using "append" or "" will result in adding these items to an existing
subscription in addition to the existing ones.

The "append" value is set for convenience, as it describes the behaviour.
The submitted value, in this case, will be "". The submitted value, in
this case, will be "".

Using "replace" results in replacing the existing subscription with the
current itmes.
See [Products subscription options](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products/subscriptions#subscription-related_product_options)

properties.name: sub_restart
properties.description:
Set to "true" to indicate that payment is collectable right now.
Set to "auto" to indicate that payment is collectable right now if the
subscription's past-due amount is greater than 0

properties.name: sub_enddate
properties.description:
Optional subscription end date encoded as four integer for the year, two
for the month and two for the day.

The absence of a sub_enddate, together with a sub_frequency, means a
subscription with indefinite and date.

See [Products wiki for more details](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products#a_complete_list_of_product_parameters)

** Example:** `"20221010"`

properties.name: frequencies
properties.description:
Optional frequency variants in the same format as `frequency`. If this property is set,
the form will render the frequency selection interface. If this array includes
the value of the `frequency` property, it will be pre-selected in the form.

**Example:** `["7d", ".5m", "1y"]`

properties.name: items
properties.description:
Optional an array of ItemInterface objects with at least the following properties:
- name: the name of the item
- price: the price of each of this item
The following optional properties will be used:
- quantity: (defaults to 1) how many of each item are added to the form
- image: an image url to be displayed in the form for this item
- items: an array of other items that are to be treated as bundled with this item
- signatures: an object containing a key value list of previously generated HMAC validation codes

Other item properties are accepted and sent to foxy cart
See [Products wiki for more details](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products#a_complete_list_of_product_parameters)

properties.name: total
properties.description: The total value of the items to be submitted.

properties.name: lang
properties.description:
Contains the language this component presents its translatable
content in. Assigning a value to this property will load new
translations in background and trigger a render afterwards.

**Example:** `"en"`

properties.name: ns
properties.description:
The namespace to look for the translations in. We use this property to
sync namespace settings with the parent element and it's highly unlikely
that you'll ever need to set or read it in your code.

**Example:** `"admin"`

events.name: change
events.description: changed form data.

events.name: submit
events.description: submitted form data

events.name: load
events.description: ProgressEvent instance with server response

slots.name: items
slots.description: items to be added to the form.

tags.name: foxy-item
tags.description:
This component allows a user to configure an item.

The item may be configured using HTML properties or a JS object.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
**Required** the name of the item.

**Example:** `"Dog food"`

attributes.name: price
attributes.description:
**Required** the price of a unit of this item

**Example:** `10`

attributes.name: image
attributes.description: Optional an image url to be displayed in the form.

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description: Optional the alt text for the image

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: Optional an image url to be displayed in the foxy cart once the custumer reaches the cart.

attributes.name: code
attributes.description:
Optional item code. This property affects cart UI only.
See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `"ISBN 978-0-12-345678-9"`

attributes.name: parent_code
attributes.description:
Optional parent code. This property affects cart UI only.
It causes Foxy Cart to recognize the parent-child relationship between two items.

Nested items set this property automatically.

**Example:** `"ISBN 978-0-12-345678-9"`

attributes.name: quantity
attributes.description: **Required** The quantity of this item in the cart.

attributes.name: quantity_max
attributes.description: Optional quantity max. The maximum number of items of these to be added.

attributes.name: quantity_min
attributes.description: Optional quantity min. The minimum number of items of these to be added.

attributes.name: category
attributes.description:
Optional category. Sets the category this item is in.
See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `"heavy"`

attributes.name: expires
attributes.description:
Optional expires. Sets the expiration time of this item.

Advanced usage only: This property affects cart UI only.
This web component will not react to this property.

The item cannot be purchased after expiration, but if it is part of a
subscription, it remains in the subscription as long as it stands.

See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `15`

attributes.name: weight
attributes.description: Optional per item weight. This property affects cart UI only.

attributes.name: shipto
attributes.description:
Optional. Specify a ship-to address for a specific item.

Advanced usage only: This property affects cart UI only.
This element does not provide any means for the user to specify this property.

attributes.name: signatures
attributes.description:
Optional open: An Object with key, value pairs where the key is a item
attribute and the value is a previously computed HMAC validation code.

**Important security information:** this web component does not generate or validates the HMAC validation code.
Please, refer to [the Product Verification page](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/hmac_validation) for more information and tools for generating the codes.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description:
Optional open: An Object with key, value pairs where the key is a item
attribute and the value is a boolean indicating that the property is editable by the user.

**Advanced use only**: this web component does not provide means for the user to alter item attributes.

See [Product Verification](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/hmac_validation) for more information.

attributes.name: length
attributes.description: Optional length.  This property affects cart UI only.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Optional width.  This property affects cart UI only.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Optional height.  This property affects cart UI only.

attributes.name: total
attributes.description:
The total price of this item.

It takes into account child items and the quantity.

attributes.name: currency
attributes.description:
3-letter lowercase currency code.
It is provided by the form if not set.

**Example:** `"usd"`

attributes.name: pid
attributes.description: A unique id set to the item. Advanced usage only.

attributes.name: items
attributes.description:
Each child item is an object that can have any of the public properties of this element.
Child elements will be created accordingly.

attributes.name: lang
attributes.description:
Contains the language this component presents its translatable
content in. Assigning a value to this property will load new
translations in background and trigger a render afterwards.

**Example:** `"en"`

attributes.name: ns
attributes.description:
The namespace to look for the translations in. We use this property to
sync namespace settings with the parent element and it's highly unlikely
that you'll ever need to set or read it in your code.

**Example:** `"admin"`

properties.name: name
properties.description:
**Required** the name of the item.

**Example:** `"Dog food"`

properties.name: price
properties.description:
**Required** the price of a unit of this item

**Example:** `10`

properties.name: image
properties.description: Optional an image url to be displayed in the form.

properties.name: alt
properties.description: Optional the alt text for the image

properties.name: url
properties.description: Optional an image url to be displayed in the foxy cart once the custumer reaches the cart.

properties.name: code
properties.description:
Optional item code. This property affects cart UI only.
See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `"ISBN 978-0-12-345678-9"`

properties.name: parent_code
properties.description:
Optional parent code. This property affects cart UI only.
It causes Foxy Cart to recognize the parent-child relationship between two items.

Nested items set this property automatically.

**Example:** `"ISBN 978-0-12-345678-9"`

properties.name: quantity
properties.description: **Required** The quantity of this item in the cart.

properties.name: quantity_max
properties.description: Optional quantity max. The maximum number of items of these to be added.

properties.name: quantity_min
properties.description: Optional quantity min. The minimum number of items of these to be added.

properties.name: category
properties.description:
Optional category. Sets the category this item is in.
See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `"heavy"`

See [Products](https://wiki.foxycart.com/v/2.0/products) wiki for more details.

**Example:** `15`

cssParts.name: picture
cssParts.description: Image of the product in preview stack (for single products) or grid (for bundles).

cssParts.name: item
cssParts.description: The root element inside of the shadow dom.

tags.name: foxy-nucleon
tags.description: Base class for custom elements working with remote HAL+JSON resources.

attributes.name: lang
attributes.description: Optional ISO 639-1 code describing the language element content is written in.

attributes.name: parent
attributes.description: Optional URL of the collection this element's resource belongs to.

attributes.name: group
attributes.description: Rumour group. Elements in different groups will not share updates. Empty by default.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: Optional URL of the resource to load. Switches element to `idle.template` state if empty (default).

properties.name: UpdateEvent
properties.description:
Instances of this event are dispatched on an element whenever it changes its
state (e.g. when going from `busy` to `idle` or on `form` data change).
This event isn't cancelable, and it does not bubble.

properties.name: Rumour
properties.description:
Creates a tagged [Rumour](https://sdk.foxy.dev/classes/_core_index_.rumour.html)
instance if it doesn't exist or returns cached one otherwise. NucleonElements
use empty Rumour group by default.

properties.name: API
properties.description:
Universal [API](https://sdk.foxy.dev/classes/_core_index_.api.html) client
that dispatches cancellable `FetchEvent` on an element before each request.

properties.name: lang
properties.description: Optional ISO 639-1 code describing the language element content is written in.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: Optional URL of the collection this element's resource belongs to.

properties.name: errors
properties.description:
Array of validation errors returned from `NucleonElement.v8n` checks.

This property is readonly. Adding or removing error codes via this property is
not guaranteed to work. NucleonElement does not provide a way to override validity status.

properties.name: form
properties.description:
Resource snapshot with edits applied. Empty object if unavailable.

This property and its value are readonly. Assignments like `element.data.foo = 'bar'`
are not guaranteed to work. Please use `element.edit({ foo: 'bar' })` instead.
If you need to replace the entire data object, consider using `element.data`.

properties.name: data
properties.description:
Resource snapshot as-is, no edits applied. Null if unavailable.

Returned value is not reactive. Assignments like `element.data.foo = 'bar'`
are not guaranteed to work. Please set the property instead: `element.data = { ...element.data, foo: 'bar' }`.
If you're processing user input, consider using `element.form` and `element.edit()` instead.
